references.paper_title: Evaluating the central-peripheral dichotomy in human visual cortex using anatomical and retinotopic data in human connectome project
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational theory of Central-Peripheral Dichotomy (CPD), which is the core concept underlying the proposed CPDTrack algorithm.

references.paper_title: Global instance tracking: Locating target more like humans
references.reason: This paper introduces the VideoCube dataset, a crucial benchmark for evaluating long-term and global instance tracking, which is directly used and extended by this paper.
This paper establishes the VOT benchmark, a widely-used and important standard for evaluating object tracking algorithms, which helps set the context for the new STDChallenge benchmark.

references.paper_title: LaSOT: A high-quality benchmark for large-scale single object tracking
references.reason: This paper presents the LaSOT dataset, a large-scale dataset for long-term tracking used to construct part of the STDChallenge Benchmark.

references.paper_title: A novel performance evaluation methodology for single-target trackers
references.reason: This paper introduces a new performance evaluation methodology for single-target trackers, influencing the design and evaluation of the new STDChallenge benchmark.
